text: <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> IL-7 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> induce heterodimerization of STAT5 isoforms in human peripheral blood T lymphoblasts .

Despite differences in T cell responses induced by <extra_id_0> interleukin (IL)-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> IL-7 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , both cytokines modulate T cell functions by activation of signal transducers and activators of transcription ( STAT ) proteins .

We examined the contribution of the two isoforms of STAT5 , <extra_id_0> STAT5A <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> STAT5B <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , to <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - and <extra_id_0> IL-7 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - induced activation of human peripheral blood T lymphoblasts .

Both cytokines induced assembly of <extra_id_0> STAT5A <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> STAT5B <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> containing complexes capable of binding to the interferon-gamma activation sequence ( GAS ) , and these complexes rapidly translocated ( within 1 min ) into the nucleus of <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - or I <extra_id_0> L-7 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - treated cells .

<extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> IL-7 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> were equivalent in their ability to induce tyrosine phosphorylation of <extra_id_0> STAT5A <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> STAT5B <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and to facilitate binding of these STATs to an immobilized GAS element .

These data suggest that <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> IL-7 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> induce assembly of STAT heterodimers in a similar manner and that subsequent cellular responses may be driven by induction of similar sets of genes .
